alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Craven; Hyde; Martin; Pitt; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 8:14PM EST until January 09 at 9:15PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Washington County in eastern North Carolina... Northwestern Craven County in eastern North Carolina... Pitt County in eastern North Carolina... Northwestern Hyde County in eastern North Carolina... Martin County in eastern North Carolina... Beaufort County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 915 PM EST. * At 813 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near House to near Wyse Fork, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Greenville, Washington, Winterville, Williamston, Ayden, Farmville, Plymouth, River Road, Bethel, Grifton, Stokes, Belhaven, Bell Arthur, Sladesville, Ransomville, Ponzer, Pinetown, Robersonville, Pungo, and Blounts Creek. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for eastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across eastern North Carolina. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST for eastern North Carolina.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Craven; Hyde; Martin; Pitt; Washington
